docs.abstract: Connecticut gubernatorial hopeful Tom Foley wins 57 percent of delegates' votes at state Republican Convention in Connecticut, but Mayor Mark D Boughton of Danbury and State Senate minority leader John McKinney also get enough votes to force a primary.

headline.main: In Connecticut, Republicans Face Primary in Race to Unseat Governor

docs.snippet: Unquantifiable arenas like history and the arts are receding from public life, replaced by technology and statistics....
docs.lead_paragraph: Unquantifiable arenas like history and the arts are receding from public life, replaced by technology and statistics.
docs.abstract: Unquantifiable arenas like history and the arts are receding from public life, replaced by technology, statistics and data that can be tracked through apps, websites and devices; some say metrics rob individuals of sense they can choose their own path, but others say its benefits far outweigh risks.
